intro: Vallesia vaupesana, commonly known as the Vaupesana beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it plays a significant role in the biodiversity of the region.
